taskbody.context:
Using the UAA Command Line Interface (UAAC), an administrator can create users in the User Account and Authentication (UAA) server. You must run UAAC setup script after downloading it from Artifactory on your UAA server. This step enables the Administrator to:
Create users.
Configure groups.
Associate the user to the groups.
Add groups as a scope to the clients.

step.cmd: Go to Artifactory and download the uaac_setup.sh file, and then open it.
step.stepresult: The available Groups appears in the echo Adding Groups section.

step.cmd: Update the following details in the uaac_setup.sh file.

ul.li: Add the users or members to the groups. To do this, enter the following command for each group.

info.p: uaac member add mes.equipment.user bm_operator_1, where mes.equipment.user denotes the group and bm_operator_1 is the user.

ul.li: If you already have your scopes defined in your UAA, upgrade the scopes to the client. To do this, add all the groups in the format, mes.<application_name>.user in the following record.
In the redirect_uri section, add all the IP addresses where you want to redirect the user.
